antprop¶

This modules gather all classes and functions related to antenna and propagation modelling.

Class Antenna¶

class pylayers.antprop.antenna.Antenna¶
antenna.Antenna¶

Class Antenna

Attributes :

name : Antenna name

Nf : number of frequency

Nt : number of theta

Np : number of phi

Ftheta : Normalized Ftheta (nf,ntheta,nphi)

Fphi : Normalized Fphi (nf,ntheta,nphi)

SqG : Square root of gain (nf,ntheta,nphi)

Ttheta : theta (nf,ntheta,nphi)

Tphi : phi (nf,ntheta,nphi)

theta : theta base 1 x ntheta

phi : phi base 1 x phi

C : VSH Coefficients
Methods :

info() : Display information about antenna

vsh() : calculates Vector Spherical Harmonics

show3_geom() : Geomview diagram

show3() : 3D diagram plotting using matplotlib toolkit

Fsynth2 : Antenna F synthesis from coeff in s2

Antenna trx file can be stored in various order :

natural : HFSS bcp : near filed chamber

It is important when initializing an antenna object to be aware of the typ of trx file :

.trx (ASCII Vectorial antenna Pattern) :
loadmat([directory]) load an antenna stored in a mat file
load_trx([directory, nf, ntheta, nphi, ncol]) load a trx file
loadtrx(directory) load trx file
checkpole([kf]) display the reconstructed field on pole for integrity verification
info() gives info about antenna object
help() help on available functions
polar([k, it, ip, dyn, GmaxdB, alpha]) polar plot
show3_geom([k, typ, mode, silent]) show3 geomview
show3([k]) k : frequency index
pol3d([k, R, St, Sp, silent]) Display polarisation diagram in 3D
mse(Fth, Fph[, N]) mean square error
elec_delay() apply an electrical delay
vshd([dsf]) This function calculates the Vector Spherical Harmonics coefficients
vsh() It makes use of the spherepack function vha
demo() display few commands for executing little demo
Fsynth(theta, phi[, k]) calculate complex antenna pattern from VSH Coefficients (shape 2)
Fsynth2(theta, phi) Calculate complex antenna pattern from VSH Coefficients (shape 2)
Fsynth3(theta, phi) synthesis of a complex antenna pattern from VSH Coefficients (shape 3)
movie_vsh([mode]) movie_vsh
minsh3([emax]) Create antenna’s vsh3 file which only contains
savevsh3() Create a .vsh3 antenna file
loadvsh3() Load antenna’s vsh3 file
savevsh2() Create a .vsh2 antenna file
loadvsh2() Load antenna’s vsh2 file which only contains
loadvsh3_old() Load antenna’s vsh3 file which only contains
pol2cart(ith) Conversion FTheta, FPhi to Fx,Fy,Fz for theta=ith
cart2pol(Fx, Fy, Fz, ith) Conversion Fx,Fy,Fz vers Ftheta, Fphi for theta=ith

class pylayers.antprop.slab.MatInterface¶
slab.MatInterface¶

MatInterface : Class for Interface between two materials

l distance from the next Interface

Notes

This is required for recursive utilization of this function when the output angle of an interface happens to be the input angle of the next interface. As this angle depends on materials which themselves depends on frequency THETA is becoming a full matrix without redundancy between lines.

>>> theta  = np.arange(0,np.pi/2,0.01)
>>> fGHz   = np.arange(3.1,10.6,0.2)
>>> Nf     = len(fGHz)
>>> Nt     = len(theta)
>>> sl     = SlabDB('def.mat','def.slab')
>>> mat    = sl.mat
>>> m1     = mat['AIR']
>>> m2     = mat['PLASTER']
>>> II     = MatInterface([m1,m2],0,fGHz,theta)

Todo

MatIinterface fix the np.pi/2 NaN problem

class pylayers.antprop.slab.Mat¶
slab.Mat¶

Handle constitutive materials dictionnary

Attributes :

name : string

name character string (default ‘AIR’)

index : int

default 1

er : complex

relative permittivity (w.d) (1+0j)

mur : complex

relative permeability (w.d) (1+0j)

sigma : float

conductivity (S/m) 0

roughness : float

(meter) 0
R(fGHz, theta) Calculate Reflection coefficient on the air|mat interface
class pylayers.antprop.slab.MatDB¶
slab.MatDB¶

MatDB Class : Material database

associate numeric and alphanumeric keys
info() get MatDB info
dass() create a dictionnary to associate index | name
maxindex() find the max value of the index in DB

edit(name) Edit a material in the DB
class pylayers.antprop.slab.Slab¶
slab.Slab¶
A slab is a sequence of layers which has
  • a given width
  • an integer index refering a given material in the material DB
Attributes :

name : :

Slab name

nbmat : :

Number of layers

index : :

Slab Index

imat : :

index of layers material

thickness : :

thickness of layers

color : :

color of slab dor display

linewidth : :

linewidth for structure display

mat : :

Associated Material Database

evaluated : Boolean
conv() build lmat and thick
editgui() edit a Slab in the DB
info() Display Slab Info
loss0([fGHz]) Calculate loss for theta=0 at frequency (f)
losst(fGHz, theta) Calculate loss for theta=th at frequency (f)
class pylayers.antprop.slab.SlabDB¶
slab.SlabDB¶

Slab data base

Attributes :DB : slab dictionnary
addgui(name) add a slab in the DB
choose() Choose a mat file from matdir and slab from slabdir
dass() update conversion dictionnary
delete(name) delete an element from the database
edit(name) edit a Slab in the DB
help() The problem with this class is to cope with 2 diferent format
info() information
load(_filename) load a .slab file (PulsRay format)
save(_filename) Save a Slab database in a .slab file (PulsRay format)
loadsl(_filename) Loadslab from a .sl file (PyRay format)
savesl(_filename) the short filename _filename needs to have the extension .sl
maxindex() find the max value of the index in DB
show([name, fGHz]) show
showall() show all
